contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "whose thumbs and big toes I told my men to cut off" or "whose thumbs and big toes we cut off" (See" [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who had their thumbs and their big toes cut off

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the people of Naphtali forced the people of Beth Shemesh and Beth Anath to work for them as slaves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the inhabitants of Beth Shemesh and Beth Anath were forced into hard labor for Naphthali

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that God gave him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he was assigned

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "who had not fought in any of the wars in Canaan" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who had not experienced any of the wars fought in Canaan

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh left these nations in Canaan" or "Yahweh allowed these nations to continue to live in Canaan" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: These nations were left

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "when he arrived at the place near Gilgal where people made carved images" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: when he reached the place where the carved images were made near Gilgal

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the Israelite army defeated the Moabites" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Moab was subdued by the strength of Israel

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "she killed him" or "he died" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he was violently killed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they noticed that someone had broken down the altar of Baal, cut down the Asherah that was beside it, and built an altar and sacrificed the second bull on it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the altar of Baal was broken down, and the Asherah that was beside it was cut down, and the second bull had been offered on the altar that had been built

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and what you hear will be encourage you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and your courage will be strengthened

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Their camels were more than anyone could count" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Their camels were more than could be counted

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Gideon called out the Israelites from the tribes of Naphtali, Asher, and all Mannasseh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The men of Israel from Naphtali, Asher, and all Manasseh were called out

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that the kings of Midian wore" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that was worn by the kings of Midian

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "So Yahweh subdued the Midianites before the people of Israel" or "So Yahweh helped the Israelites defeat the Midianites" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: So Midian was subdued before the people of Israel

contextId.information: The passive phrases can be stated in active form. AT: "God did this to avenge the seventy sons whom Abimelech their brother murdered and the men of Shechem helped murder" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: God did this so the violence done ... helped him murder his brothers

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Someone told Abimelech about the men waiting to attack him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: This was reported to Abimelech

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "someone reported this to Abimelech" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: this was reported to Abimelech

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and they buried him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and was buried

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Jair the Gileadite was leader after Tola" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: He was followed by Jair the Gileadite

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they buried him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: was buried

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They killed forty-two thousand Ephraimites" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Forty-two thousand Ephraimites were killed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Jephthah the Gileadite died and they buried him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Jephthah the Gileadite died and was buried

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "his wife's father gave her to his best friend" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Samson's wife was given to his best friend

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "bind you to control you" or "bind you to restrain you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: bind you, so you might be controlled

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that have not yet dried" or "that are not dry yet" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that have not been dried

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that had not yet dried" or "that were not dry yet" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that had not been dried

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "If someone shaves my head" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: If my head is shaved

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "which someone stole from you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that were taken from you

contextId.information: The word "they" refers to the metal figures. This may be stated in active form. AT: "Micah placed them in his house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they were placed in the house of Micah

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "he called together the men who were in the houses near his house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the men who were in the houses near Micah's house were called together

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "kill you and your family" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you and your family will be killed

contextId.information: Change to active voice. AT: "and we have plenty of bread and wine" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and there is bread and wine

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "we have defeated them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they are defeated before us

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "we killed all the Benjamite women" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the women of Benjamin have been killed
